Original data sources uk police area populations.


- [population and police numbers](https://researchbriefings.files.parliament.uk/documents/SN00634/SN00634.pdf) 
- [data for map boundries](https://data.gov.uk/dataset/a9d70493-3780-4c3d-85c7-a3d315d7d0a4/police-force-areas-december-2016-generalised-clipped-boundaries-in-england-and-wales)
-[ individual crime data](https://data.police.uk/#:~:text=Welcome%20to%20data.police.uk,England%2C%20Wales%20and%20Northern%20Ireland.&text=You%20can%20also%20download%20data,arrests%20and%20101%20call%20handling.) 

Known Issues with the individual crime data:

- Court outcomes from June 2019 onwards are currently unavailable. We are working with the MoJ to provide this data over the coming months.
- Avon and Somerset Constabulary: Due to a change in IT systems there are known issues with crime and outcome data since October 2015 as latitude and longitude information is missing from approximately 2000 crimes each month. The force will be working to rectify this and provide the missing data over the coming months.
- British Transport Police: ASB data has not been provided for period April 2016 onwards. The force will rectify this issue and provide the missing data over the coming months.
- Greater Manchester Police: Due to a change in IT systems no crime, outcome or stop and search data is available from July 2019 onwards. The force are working to rectify this issue and provide the missing data over the coming months.
- Gwent Police: No further action disposals are missing from April 2018 to June 2018. We are working with the force to establish the cause of these issues and to resolve this.
- Kent Police: Only partial crime and outcome data is available for May 2019. The force will rectify this issue and provide the missing data over the coming months.
- Lincolnshire Police: Due to IT issues, Crime data and Stop and Search data can’t be provided for September. The force aims to rectify this issue as soon as possible in the coming months.
- West Mercia Police: Due to a change in IT systems, there was a 60% drop in Outcome data from September to October 2017, plus drops in subsequent months. But while these data are still missing, the drops gradually decreased so that there was a steady increase back to normal levels, reached in July 2018. Due to further technical issues, ASB data have not been submitted from July 2020 onward. The force is rectifying the ASB issues and will provide the data over the coming months.
- West Midlands Police: Due to recent major system changes, the force is unable to provide Crime and Stop and Search data from April 2021 onwards. The force aims to rectify this issue as soon as possible in the coming months.
- Wiltshire Police: Due to Stop and Search data forms being completed manually there is a data lag of up to 6 weeks with these forms being processed. The force aims to rectify this as soon as possible and will provide the data over the coming months.
